sen.j: 香川元春（かがわ もとはる）は室町時代末期から安土桃山時代の讃岐国の武将。
sen.e: Motoharu KAGAWA is a warlord of Sanuki Province (Kagawa Prefecture) who lived from the late Muromachi period to sometime in the Azuchi-Momoyama period.
Motoharu KAGAWA was a busho (Japanese military commander) of Sanuki Province (Kagawa Prefecture) who lived from the late Muromachi period to sometime in the Azuchi-Momoyama period.
sen.cmt: is→was, ”武将”の部分を修正しました。（用語統一）
sen.e: Motoharu KAGAWA was a busho (Japanese military commander) of Sanuki Province (Kagawa Prefecture) who lived from the late Muromachi period to sometime in the Azuchi-Momoyama period.

sen.j: 西讃の守護代香川氏の筆頭家老。
sen.e: He was the head of chief retainers of the Kagawa clan which was Shugodai (the deputy provincial military governor) of Sanuki Province.
He was the head of chief retainers of the Kagawa clan which was the Shugodai (the deputy provincial military governor) of Sanuki Province.
He was the head of chief retainers of the Kagawa clan which was the Shugodai (the deputy provincial military governor) of Sanuki Province.
His official court rank was Yamashiro no kuni no kami (the governor of Yamashiro Province [the southern half of Kyoto Prefecture]).
His official court rank was Yamashiro no kuni no kami (the governor of Yamashiro Province.
sen.cmt: カッコ部分を削除しました。（「仕様指示書」における”「新たな情報の追加」を避け”に従い）
sen.e: His official court rank was Yamashiro no kuni no kami (the governor of Yamashiro Province.
He was the master of Takaya-jo Castle in Sanuki Province.
He was the castellan of Takaya-jo Castle in Sanuki Province.
He was the castellan of Takaya-jo Castle in Sanuki Province.

sen.j: 香川氏在京家の「五郎」を通称とする一族の一人。
sen.e: He was one of the Kagawa clan' 在京家 who had a common name of 'Goro.'
sen.cmt: 「在京家」は他に使用例がなく辞書等でも見当たりません。読み、意味共に不明です。
sen.e: He was one of the Kagawa clan's 在京家 who had a common name of 'Goro.'
sen.cmt: clan'→clan's と修正しました。”在京＝京に在る”の意味かと思いましたが、確認できないのでそのままにしてあります。
sen.e: He was one of the Kagawa clan's 在京家 who had a common name of 'Goro.'

sen.j: 「五郎次郎」を通称とする香川宗家に仕える。
sen.e: He served the Kagawa clan's head family who had a common name of 'Gorojiro.'
He served the Kagawa clan's head family who had a common name of 'Gorojiro.'
He served the Kagawa clan's head family who had a common name of 'Gorojiro.'

sen.j: 香川之景が長宗我部元親に降る際、同家家老の河田七郎兵衛、同弥太郎、三野栄久と共に二人ずつ交代で岡豊城に赴いた。
sen.e: When Yukikage KAGAWA surrendered to Motochika CHOSOKABE, Motoharu headed out to Oko-jo Castle by tows in turn in cooperation with Yukikage's chief retainers Shichirobe KAWATA, Yataro KAWATA and Yoshihisa SANNO.

When Yukikage KAGAWA surrendered to Motochika CHOSOKABE, Motoharu went to Oko-jo Castle by twos in turn in cooperation with Yukikage's chief retainers Shichirobe KAWATA, Yataro KAWATA and Yoshihisa SANNO.
sen.cmt: headed out→went,tows→twos と修正しました。
sen.e: When Yukikage KAGAWA surrendered to Motochika CHOSOKABE, Motoharu went to Oko-jo Castle by twos in turn in cooperation with Yukikage's chief retainers Shichirobe KAWATA, Yataro KAWATA and Yoshihisa SANNO.

sen.j: 善通寺合戦や金倉合戦、長宗我部家の讃州平定戦など香川氏の関わる戦には常に参戦し、また、香川之景が織田信長に通じる際には外交官としても活躍している。
sen.e: Motoharu always participated in the battles in which the Kagawa clan was involved, such as the Battle of Zentsuji, the Battle of Kanakura and Sanshu Heitei-sen (the battle to pacify Sanuki Province) of the Chosokabe clan, and played a lively part as a diplomat when Yukikage KAGAWA secretly communicated with Nobunaga ODA.

Motoharu always joined the battles in which the Kagawa clan was involved, such as the Battle of Zentsuji, the Battle of Kanakura and Sanshu Heitei-sen (the battle to suppress Sanuki Province) of the Chosokabe clan, and played a lively part as a diplomat when Yukikage KAGAWA secretly communicated with Nobunaga ODA.
sen.cmt: participated in→joined,pacify→suppress と修正しました。
sen.e: Motoharu always joined the battles in which the Kagawa clan was involved, such as the Battle of Zentsuji, the Battle of Kanakura and Sanshu Heitei-sen (the battle to suppress Sanuki Province) of the Chosokabe clan, and played a lively part as a diplomat when Yukikage KAGAWA secretly communicated with Nobunaga ODA.
